report.summary: Tweetlanes forgets the last viewed lane on opening
report.label: bug
report.description: Occasionally rather than displaying the last viewed lane (usually the timeline) Tweetlanes will display another lane when opened. In my case this is usually the "My Tweets" lane, though this may depend on the order of the lanes and which you have visible. Ideally you should be able to mark a lane as default and have it always open there, or opt to display whichever lane was visible when the app was closed.

report.label: bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Follow / Unfollow buttons do not appear
report.label: bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.label: bug
report.description: When going into the tweet details view and there to the discussion tab, the current version of TweetLanes in the play store displays only "No content loaded at this time." Refreshing that view displays "Loading...", but nothing ever happens. In previous versions this worked.

report.summary: features not working on tweet details activity
report.label: bug
report.description: Retweet and favorite buttons don't have any effect; "discussion" constantly shows "no content loaded at this time" and refreshing does not help.

report.summary: Large font size setting clips user names in TL view
report.label: bug
report.description: See the screenshot. When you choose the Large font size in the settings, the font size of the user name is also larger and the lower part of the character (most stuff under the baseline) is clipped. This does not happen if you choose any other font size. With any other font size, from Extra small to Extra large, the font size of the user name appears to stay the same. Hence no clipping. Only when you choose the Large font, the user names are also displayed larger and get clipped.

report.label: bug
report.description: It's fairly easy to get the "Rate Limit Exceeded" message on a Twitter account. Unsure if this is due to API 1.1 changes or the App.net changes (or some combination of the two). Reproduce: Keep scrolling through timeline Switch between Twitter and App.net account

report.summary: Tap a link in a tweet - incorrect behaviour
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce:- Find tweet with a link to user/hashtag/link. Click link on the tweet Tweet detail is opened (or url if external link) - Unwanted action Press back or close browser and the users profile/hashtag search is opened - this is what should have been shown at 3 Press back again to take you to the tweet list. What should happen: click username/hashtag/link within tweet user profile/search/url opens press back to return to tweet list This may have been caused by this merge as I never noticed this behaviour prior to this:- #9

report.label: bug
report.description: When switching accounts, the last read status is not always remember (or remembered wrong). This often puts you at the top of the timeline when looking at the new account.

report.label: bug
report.description: When posting a long ADN post, you get the following error, even though the post is not 256 characters. Message also needs to contain the word "post" if ADN.

report.summary: Switching accounts while loading statuses displays previous accounts statuses in new account's lane
report.label: bug
report.description: This was spun off #34 (and not directly related). If you, ideally on a slow connection, start loading on tweets on account 1 (scroll down until you get "Loading") and then quickly switch to account 2, the statuses from account 1 are loaded into the lane for account 2.

report.label: bug
report.description: When pressing the save image button in the image viewer, 2 copies are saved. One in dcim/camera/ folder and a second in pictures/tweet lanes/

report.summary: Viewing profile of protected users on Twitter causes FC
report.label: bug
report.description: When viewing the profile of a protected user, the application crashes.

report.summary: Reset API support back to API 14
report.label: bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: ADN: Crashes when set to view My Posts
report.label: bug
report.description: I just tried to view My Posts, and now TweetLanes crashes every time I was load it.

report.label: bug
report.description: I am getting crashes when the post count on the Global Feed goes way wrong. I just don't think there can be 1100+ posts in under a few seconds. This might be related to issue #61.

report.summary: Use HTTPS for all Twitter calls
report.label: bug
report.description: Reported by @mls768: couple of weeks ago I found that some @tweetlanes api are done over http since I was able to see full http api request on wireshark. All calls should be HTTPS.

report.summary: New posts/tweets bar will reappear after reading all new posts
report.label: bug
report.description: The "{count} New Posts" blue bar will reappear in the lanes after viewing all new posts. To reproduce: Go to a lane with new posts, Scroll to the top until the message appears, Scroll a few posts back down, When scrolling up the blue bar will reappear.

report.summary: Star/retweets post corners don't show up
report.label: bug
report.description: When I star or retweet a post the corner of the post does not show the star or retweet corner. (I'm very sleepy so I hope this makes sense)

report.label: bug
report.description: I used TweetLanes with app.net. To test something, i de-authorized it from the app.net website. Since then, my TweetLanes app keeps crashing. This is loosely related to #81

report.label: bug
report.description: Repo steps: In portrait mode Open a tweet to reply. Start writing reply Change to landscape Modify tweet, or do nothing (both have same effect) Go back to portrait Try and carry on with reply All previous text gone

report.label: bug
report.description: Seems to be missing.

report.label: bug
report.description: Repo steps Open tweet Press on reply box Press back to leave box Reply usernames gone

report.label: bug
report.description: Notification often has the wrong number of new mentions. Not sure if dm notifications also effected.

report.label: bug
report.description: The number always seems to be one lower than actual. I.e. 3 new tweets, bar says 2.

report.label: bug
report.description: Description says 1 new tweets. But 2 new tweet. Quick look and the logic for the bar saying if 2 new, the use singular. Also, if you scroll down, the bar vanishes. It should stay, but the number shouldn't go up. After scrolling down, when you scroll back up, you have loads of "new" tweets. Second 2 are sort of related.

report.label: bug
report.description: When replying (even if the reply tweet was yours) don't include your own handle in the reply.

report.summary: Add check for 0kb images before adding to cache.
report.label: bug
report.description: Sometimes we seem to get an error downloading profile image. Files appear to be 0kb when this happens. Retry image download, and don't add broken image to cache.

report.label: bug
report.description: The "bigger" image always downloaded. Then scaled down. Could this not download image closer to the required size. I.e mini, normal or bigger?

report.label: bug
report.description: May be related to the lack of tweet marker support, but sometimes the lanes reset back a few tweets, forgetting where I last got to.

report.label: bug
report.description: This had to be changed as part of the api v1.1 work. We need to look in twitter4j for another was to get the full conversation.

report.label: bug
report.description: when you refresh in the spotlight, the RT dog ear goes.

report.summary: Status' not being passed back from spotlight
report.label: bug
report.description: This is a blocker on the release. Needs to be fixed before we can put out...sorry.

report.summary: Crash when RT on action bar fails
report.label: bug
report.description: Note for me mainly. Null pointer around line 1190 in tweet fragment. Would appear I need a check so make sure that the status is not null. A null status mean failure.

report.summary: Some tweets with images don't have preview
report.label: bug
report.description: This includes some pic.twitter tweets.

report.label: bug
report.description: reported by @xodeus on twitter. On looking into the image, the details are as follows: 3.7mb image at a resolution of 4208 x 3120. It is believed that tweetlanes should be resizing the image.

report.label: bug
report.description: When you get a notification for dm, would expect the dm lane to load, not the mention one.

report.summary: Retweeted by x and y others
report.label: bug
report.description: It would apear the y others number includes the name of the main person. I.e if I had a tweet, and retweeted by @bob and @Bill, it would say retweeted by bob and 2 others. This should say 1 other

report.label: bug
report.description: When acting on callback. It would seem in some cases the tweet cannot be located to apply the dogear. This is very tricky to replicate!

report.summary: Delete tweet from cache on callback
report.label: bug
report.description: Currently, tweets are removed straight away, not after callback completes.

report.summary: Notifications don't auto-start after a reboot
report.label: bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.label: bug
report.description: The example i have seen is that an instagram link with a capital I will not be regarded as a media link. The string checking for types of link (by definition of using java) is case sensitive. Both sides of the comparison should have their case the same. Also to note, on a lot of these types of links, the case of the "code" needs to remain in tact.

report.label: bug
report.description: The compose bar changes colour depending on I'd you are composing or not Also dm bar is always the same colour as when composing. I think standardise on the non composing colour (the new one)

report.label: bug
report.description: A fullstop the @ doesn't show auto complete. Also, I seem to be missing people I follow on my auto complete.

report.label: bug
report.description: Dashclock support isn't working.

report.label: bug
report.description: Error when refresh and reload saying something like too many terms in search. Happens a lot, and prob should be fixed before store version.

report.label: bug
report.description: Reports of issues uploading images. Tried to upload an image with the beta to no success.

report.label: bug
report.description: It looks like we do an auto expand of the t.co URL. though i had a DM which still shows the t.co url. Can we also auto expand these.

report.label: bug
report.description: When unselecting tweets the reply doesnt reset to the what's new.

report.label: bug
report.description: When sharing the item being shared is lost.

report.label: bug
report.description: When open profile from a link in tweet the @ user doesn't show. When open from profile pic it does.

report.label: bug
report.description: @Fammy profile has a t.co link in the text. not sure what it's meant to say but t.co links look nasty.

report.label: bug
report.description: Only seems to happen on adn. Guessing it's got something to do with the status ids.

report.label: bug
report.description: This didn't show on my device post update.

report.summary: Show full URL in the tweet
report.label: bug
report.description: It looks like TweetLanes is expanding the t.co links, but then it cuts it short at some hardcoded length? and adds "..." to the end. Would be nice to see the full URL though.

report.summary: Clicking on the preview image shows an error
report.label: bug
report.description: So I can see image preview in the timeline, however when I press/click on it, it tries to load it (again?) on separate screen but fails. I guess the image is not cached. Also there is no way to refresh or try again.

report.label: bug
report.description: Auto link now puts http at start of link. If I put the text app.net Twitter make this a t.co. When it's displayed, it gets http:// put on front. Not sure if we can stop it, but makes some text look funny. In particular when talking about something .net. I.e app.net, asp.net, vb.net.

report.summary: Username in compose after viewing profile
report.label: bug
report.description: I thought I had fixed this one, but looks like it's back. Repo steps: Open a profile Leave profile by back button, or in app back Go into compose window Usename already populated.

report.summary: Notification bar re-appears if you have "screen rotation" on and tilt your phone
report.label: bug
report.description: So I can reproduce this consistently. If i have "screen rotation" enabled while viewing my timeline if I change the phone orientation the "notification bar" shows up.

report.label: bug
report.description: The link on profile is a t.co Needs to be expanded. Should be an easy fix.

report.label: bug
report.description: Tweetlanes seems to be able to forget the list position. You have lots of lanes set up a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i (d to i could be lists, but this can also be reproduced on timeline and mentions etc). Open app refresh an active lane (i.e. lane g) with a few (i.e. 15) new tweets. Scroll to top of lane (i.e. lane g). Swipe two (or more) lanes left (i.e. to lane e) or right (i.e. to lane i) Swipe back to lane g position is back to what it was before reloading lane at 1. You can make it remember position by swiping 1 left or right then back to lane or not fully scrolling to the top (although this can be temperamental and cause other lanes to jump to top, however this specific jump may be unrelated as i haven't been able to reproduce on the build BlythMeister supplied today). You can also open tweet detail and go back to lane, or exit app and reopen and it will remember the last position. If you need some lists to subscribe to for checking with multiple lanes, there are a few busy ones here:- https://twitter.com/London2012/lists/olympians https://twitter.com/NASA/lists/astronauts There are plenty of others, or make your own - tweetlanes is awesome with lots of lists ;)

report.summary: Holo Light w/Dark action bar missing conversation icon
report.label: bug
report.description: The new theme seems to not load the conversation icon until you click on it. See below... Middle one is the one missing the arrow, left shows it after it's been clicked on and right shows that the icon is fine on dark theme - also fine on light theme.

report.label: bug
report.description: Save image on ADN doesn't seem to work.

report.label: bug
report.description: Character count doesn't take into account the attached image url length. When image attached, a set number of extra characters should be added.

report.label: bug
report.description: When status is a RT, in main feed picture shows, but when you view spotlight it doesn't show the media.

report.label: bug
report.description: When using auto complete mid status the status is modified and overwritten. Sometimes the username just goes on the end.

report.label: bug
report.description: When refreshing in landscape with camera on the right, the screen rotates a full 180, then back again. Would guess the lock rotate is having strange effects.

report.label: bug
report.description: With a previous release I added recusion to get all new statuses. However, if everytime Twitter is called an extra 1 status is found, you could end up in a nasty loop. I've seen situations where refresh takes ages, this could be an explanation.

report.label: bug
report.description: When I expand some discussion whith several replys, I see that it duplicates in another thread which I don't expand

report.summary: Sharing a post from App.Net provides a Twitter URL instead
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi! This is my first post here, so I hope I didn't miss anything. Using Android 4.2 and Tweet Lanes 1.3.0 When sharing a post from App.Net and selecting "Link to Tweet", it shares a wrong URL: https://twitter.com/username/status/12345678 Instead of this URL from App.Net: https://alpha.app.net/username/post/12345678 Besides, "Link to Tweet" could also be changed to "Link to Post" to match ADN's terminology. Thanks!

report.label: bug
report.description: When favorite a status icon shows but not sent to Twitter.

report.label: bug
report.description: Twitter4J supports gzip compression on request response. We don't seem to set this to true, so may relate to why get status seems slow. If not that, then the request processing may have something slowing process down?!

report.label: bug
report.description: Unable to login with twitter on android 4.4.4 and L
